Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Sean Spicer declared that President Trump has the legal right to cancel and disband the Supreme Court of the United States.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to support the statement that President Trump has the legal right to cancel and disband the Supreme Court.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by suggesting that the president holds the power to disband the Supreme Court based on a quote from Sean Spicer that was manipulated and taken out of context.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Supreme Court was not mentioned during the briefing and Sean Spicer did not suggest that the president holds the power to disband the Supreme Court.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the quote from Sean Spicer was manipulated and taken out of context to create a false claim about the president's power to disband the Supreme Court.
